title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted the November 8, 2025 episode of 'Saturday Night Live' with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser's rise in popularity began in 2024 with her standout performance at the Tom Brady roast.
Pete Davidson returned to the 'Weekend Update' desk during Glaser's episode of 'SNL.'

title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial insurance goal in the Bruins' 5-3 win against the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten, once a top Toronto prospect, was traded to Boston last season as part of a deal involving Brandon Carlo.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm praised Minten, calling him 'the best player on the ice' after the game in Toronto.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame, receiving a ring and plaque in Toronto.
Chara shared the induction moment with fellow Bruin, Joe Thornton, both named to the 2025 Hall of Fame class.
Chara, a 14-year Bruins captain and Stanley Cup winner, expressed awe at joining hockey legends.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are involved in free agency for Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, Munetaka Murakami, Dylan Cease, and Framber Valdez.
Boston's payroll allows them $25 million below first and $45 million below second luxury tax threshold for new signings.
Bregman and Schwarber seen as strong fits, but predictions show mixed expectations for their signing with the Red Sox.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on Nov. 7, 2025, showcasing songs from his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
Legend's setlist included a medley of covers, highlighting his influences and collaborations with artists like Kanye West and Alicia Keys.
The concert featured Legend's solo performances, as well as covers by The Beatles and The Staple Singers, drawing on his versatile musical style.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, implying refs influenced fourth-quarter gameplay.
Brown bluntly criticized refs in a previous 105-103 loss to the Jazz, citing a missed foul call crucial to the game's outcome.
Despite his comments, Brown wasn't fined for his remarks after the Jazz game, as the league acknowledged the missed foul call.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield is considered an MVP candidate, leading the team with 1,919 passing yards and 13 touchdowns.
Rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards and five touchdowns but faces challenges against Patriots' strong man coverage.
Buccaneers are facing injuries with key players like Mike Evans and Chris Godwin out, relying on replacements for upcoming game.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, marking their first Patriots game in over two years.
CBS's top announcing team calls Patriots games more frequently than most, highlighting renewed interest in the team under QB Drake Maye.
Nantz and Romo initially expected to cover Bills-Dolphins, but Miami's poor season shifted focus to the Tampa game.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points for the Celtics, but the team's three-point shooting struggled at 1-for-6.
Orlando Magic capitalized with 17 three-pointers, finishing 47.2% from deep, while Franz Wagner scored 27 points.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces a public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety during a 2018 ICE incident.
A state hearing officer found insufficient evidence that Judge Joseph authorized the escape plan of a migrant from ICE.
Federal obstruction charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022 after agreeing to a state investigation of misconduct.
